column4: Field survey of outlet drops; optional LiDAR/imagery support.

column12: Adjust outlet-drop threshold for focal taxa and stream type.

column4: Aerial imagery time series + gage/model zero-flow days (where available) + field confirmation of withdrawals/diversions.

column10: Define historically perennial extent; map dry segments during target season(s); compute % length dry.
column11: SFARI rapid assessment; USGS gage records where available; local water use/diversion datasets.
column12: Separate perennial vs naturally intermittent classes (SDAM or local classification).

column4: Aerial imagery + field reconnaissance during critical low-flow season.
column7: Connectivity is maintained without long dry gaps that block organism movement.

column10: Map dry gaps along channel; measure longest continuous gap length.
column11: SFARI rapid assessment; imagery sources; optional gage/model support.
column12: Evaluate during biologically critical period (e.g., late summer).

column4: Levee/berm/wall/riprap mapping from LiDAR/imagery + field verification.

column8: Percent of reach bankline bordered by continuous barriers that prevent lateral movement (lower is better).
column10: Map barriers along banks; compute barrier length ÷ total bankline length.
column11: National Levee Database (NLD); FEMA floodplain layers (where available); USGS 3DEP LiDAR; local levee GIS.
column12: Stratify by valley confinement; exclude naturally constrained canyon walls.

column4: Barrier mapping (LiDAR/imagery) + field verification of gaps.

column8: Length of the longest uninterrupted levee/berm/wall segment along either bank (lower is better).
column10: Dissolve mapped barriers by continuity; compute maximum segment length.
column11: NLD; FEMA floodplain; LiDAR hillshade; local infrastructure GIS.
column12: Consider only barriers that block movement at ground level (not vegetated natural berms).

column4: Dam/weir/culvert inventory (PAD-US/dam layers/road crossings) + passability scoring.
column7: Few barriers occur within the connected corridor; passage is maintained for organisms and sediment.
column8: Severity-weighted barrier density per km (e.g., sum of (1passability) per km). Lower is better.
column10: Compile barriers; assign passability (01); compute ?(1passability)/km within analysis corridor.
column11: SFARI rapid assessment; dam/barrier inventories; field confirmation protocols.
column12: Compute separately for fish vs other taxa; choose corridor length (e.g., 520 km).

column4: Barrier inventory + corridor network analysis; optional field verification.

column10: Define corridor; apply barrier passability; compute accessible length ÷ total corridor length.
column11: SFARI rapid assessment; barrier inventories; network connectivity methods.
